title: How to Make Winter Pesto Crostini

steps.headline: Place ice and cold water into a large bowl.
Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the kale.
Shock the kale into the cold water immediately.
steps.description: Shocking stops the cooking process, but allows the color to keep intact. Drain any excess water when cooled down.

steps.headline: Add the kale, spinach, parsley, nuts, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper flakes into a food processor.
steps.description: While pulsing, drizzle the olive oil in. Avoid over processing or else it'll turn into "baby food mush".

steps.headline: Serve bread rolls, Crostini, or crackers with a teaspoon of the pesto spread.

text: Place ice and cold water into a large bowl.  Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the kale. Blanch the kale for 4 minutes. Shock the kale into the cold water immediately. Shocking stops the cooking process, but allows the color to keep intact. Drain any excess water when cooled down. Add the kale, spinach, parsley, nuts, garlic, rosemary, salt, and pepper flakes into a food processor. While pulsing, drizzle the olive oil in. Avoid over processing or else it'll turn into "baby food mush". Serve bread rolls, Crostini, or crackers with a teaspoon of the pesto spread. Grate fresh Parmesan on top.
